common.name: Name
common.topic-info: to trigger the action on this node, do not forget the incoming 'msg' MUST contain a 'msg.topic' which is either 'state/__topicName__' (when used in read-only mode) or 'cmd/__topicName__' (when used in write mode), otherwise node will skip incoming message.
common.option-smartfilter-info:
SmartFilter is enabled by default, making the node only triggering a new flow (aka output) when a state CHANGED after a MyHome BUS message was received.
This is made to avoid multiple flows starting for the same info/command, because MyHome sends the same message multiple times (for status request, response,...) 

Note: SmartFilter is never applied when node is running in read-only (status update request) mode.
common.option-smartfilter-out-checkbox: Filter outgoing commands sent to gateway
common.option-skipevents-info: If necessary, all MyHome status updates received from the gateway about this node can be ignored, which means only Node-RED received payloads will be processed.
common.option-readonly-checkbox: Only ask for current load status
common.option-readonly-info: When enabled, the received payload (being 'ON', 'OFF', or whatever) is ignored and a status request is sent to gather current state without applying any change.
common.secondary-output-intro: You may fine-tune the secondary output to better suit your needs when integrating with other node mechanisms (see node help for more info).
common.secondary-output-name-info: Is the property name on the returned payload (i.e. payload.propertyname). When left empty, the payload is returned as a single value (i.e. not as an object)

config.option-smartfilter-out-info:
SmartFilter can be enabled to avoid sending unnecessary commands to the gateway. The node will define whether a command is useful based on the last known state of the node (e.g. when a light is known to be 'on', it is not necessary to send another command to turn it on again). When the received message (msg.payload) is judged 'useless', the node stops the flow (i.e. no message is sent to an output).

Note that, if used for groups, the node will only rely on the last calls it made itself, since groups have no status as such on the MyHome system...
